thread.title: UPDATE 1-Brazil's finance minister cancels G20 trip to meet Rousseff
thread.title_full: UPDATE 1-Brazil's finance minister cancels G20 trip to meet Rousseff | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: UPDATE 1-Brazil's finance minister cancels G20 trip to meet Rousseff
text:
(Adds information from government officials, market reaction, policy debate)
By Alonso Soto
BRASILIA, Sept 3 (Reuters) - Brazilian Finance Minister Joaquim Levy on Thursday canceled his trip to the G20 summit in Turkey to meet with President Dilma Rousseff about a 2016 budget bill later in the day, two government officials told Reuters.
Beating back speculation that Levy was preparing to step down, both officials, who spoke on condition of anonymity, said the finance minister had no plans to resign.
Brazil's currency rebounded from 12-year lows on the news, firming 0.6 percent in afternoon trading. Earlier in the day, the currency fell as much 1.5 percent after newspapers Folha de S.Paulo and Valor Economico reported that Levy was isolated and frustrated by a budget bill submitted on Monday.
That budget bill was Brazil's first ever to forecast a primary deficit, highlighting Levy's failure to shore up federal accounts in an effort to save the country's investment-grade rating.
Planning Minister Nelson Barbosa, who has gained influence in economic policy as Levy's austerity agenda makes enemies in Congress and other ministries, has defended the deficit projection in recent days as a sign of transparency and realism.
A finance ministry spokeswoman confirmed Levy's meeting with Rousseff on Thursday, but declined to say what the meeting was about. Levy is maintaining travel plans for Spain and France early next week, she added. (Reporting by Alonso Soto; Additional reporting by Bruno Federowski and Brad Haynes in Sao Paulo; Editing by Bernard Orr )
